title: Fleabag star addresses bringing show back after Emmy wins
text:
From Digital Spy

Note: There are minor spoilers for the second series finale of Fleabag below.

Fleabag star Phoebe Waller-Bridge has playfully addressed if she's having second thoughts about closing the door on the cult comedy with its second series.

The show swept the Primetime Emmy Awards over the weekend, winning Waller-Bridge and the BBC awards for Outstanding Comedy Series, Lead Actress and Writing.

Photo credit: Jerod Harris - Getty Images More

In the press room following her wins, Entertainment Tonight asked Waller-Bridge if she was now re-evaluating her decision to wrap up Fleabag so soon.

"I mean, to be honest, this just feels like the most beautiful, beautiful way to say goodbye to it, actually," she answered.

The writer and actress went on: "It does feel like the story is complete... It's so nice to hear that so many people loved it. I'm a bit like, 'Aw, damn it, maybe she shouldn't have waved goodbye at the end'. But it does feel right. It feels right to go out on a high, and you can't get higher than this."

Photo credit: BBC More

Waller-Bridge hasn't completely put Fleabag behind her. She recently wrapped up a sold-out stage version of the series at London's Wyndham's Theatre following a successful Broadway run.

She also had more success at the Emmys on Sunday night when Jodie Comer won the Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series for Killing Eve, which Waller-Bridge adapted for TV and produces.

Photo credit: Jeff Kravitz - Getty Images More

Waller-Bridge has also written the next James Bond film No Time to Die, which will be released in the UK on April 3, 2020 and in the US on April 8, 2020.

description: "Maybe she shouldn't have waved goodbye at the end."
